easy.notes: Category explanations: (1) Animals by Habitat groups familiar animals by where they live; (2) Sleep Essentials are items used for sleeping; (3) Everyday Kitchen Items are common objects found in most kitchens; (4) Things That Float include items that commonly rise on water. Near-miss temptation: 'Duck' could fit both Animals by Habitat and Things That Float—but in this puzzle it’s clearly categorized under 'Things That Float' as a common object that floats, not a living animal.

groups.name: Outdoor Things You See in a Park

medium.notes: Category explanations: (1) Words starting with 'Sun' show simple prefix wordplay; (2) House parts are common, single-word items; (3) Park items are typical outdoor objects you’d encounter; (4) School subjects are familiar categories. Near-miss temptation: 'Window' and 'Door' could be misread as 'parts of a house' vs 'things you can open' but here they belong to Parts of a House. Ensure kids map each item to its group by the main cue in the group name.

hard.notes: Category explanations: (1) Weather symbols are simple pictograms; (2) Transportation modes are familiar but require recognizing different vehicle types; (3) Communication methods include both physical and digital/lingual channels; (4) Things that come in pairs are items typically found as two. Near-miss temptation: 'Handshakes' could seem like a communication method or a social gesture; defined here as a communication method because it involves exchanging signals. Unique mapping kept to avoid overlap.
